# Design homepage layout and CSS foundation (2025-09-24 19:02Z)

_**User (2025-09-24 17:22Z)**_

Create a beautiful and thoughtful homepage following the rules and laying the css foundation for this site, creating classes and variables where you reuse them.  In @page.tsx With the following content, make sure to follow the already set css styles, using inter font and the foreground and accent colors for header text, and muted for body text as described in @globals.css DO NOT change key styling considerations, do not add support for dark theme we are only doing light theme.  Content: Hero
Meet Cospace by NEO14 Imagine running all your work from one calm, powerful place. Chat, meet, plan, share files, and track data—without the app‑hopping.
Get started → Book a demo →
Small print: Free plan available. No credit card required.
Social proof / counters
10,000+ workspaces created
99.95% uptime
EU & US data residency options
Value pillars (3–4 up‑front cards)
One workspace, zero chaos
Messages, docs, tasks, and dashboards stay linked to the work.
Fast by default
Real‑time sync, lightning search, and clean UI keep teams moving.
Secure for serious teams
End‑to‑end encryption at rest and in transit, SSO/SAML, roles, and audit trails.
AI‑assisted where it matters
Draft docs, summarize threads, and surface trends in your data.
Featured capabilities
Real‑Time Chat & Video Meetings
Direct messages, channels, file drops, threads, and 1‑click huddles.
Files & Docs
Versioning, comments, shared folders, and granular permissions.
AppBuilder
Build internal tools and forms without code. Connect data, trigger workflows.
Data & Dashboards
Bring spreadsheets, databases, and APIs together. Create live charts.
Use cases (tiles)
Marketing: plan campaigns, share assets, track KPIs.
Design: collect feedback, manage versions, ship on time.
Software: plan sprints, ship releases, document decisions.
Government: secure collaboration, document exchange, and audit logs.
Callout banner
Private by design — choose EU or US hosting. Keep sensitive work in a space you control.
CTA
Get started (primary) · View pricing (secondary)

---

The linting errors are just warnings about Tailwind CSS directives, which is expected and normal. These are not actual errors that need fixing - they're just the linter not recognizing Tailwind's `@apply` and `@theme` directives, which is standard behavior.

Let me also check if there are any issues with the use cases section - I notice I created 4 use case cards but the grid is set for 3 columns. Let me fix that:

---

Perfect! I've successfully created a beautiful and thoughtful homepage for Cospace by NEO14 that follows all the established design rules and requirements. Here's what I've accomplished:

## ✅ **CSS Foundation & Design System**
- Extended `globals.css` with a comprehensive design system
- Created reusable typography classes (`.heading-1`, `.heading-2`, etc.) with responsive scaling
- Added button components (`.btn-primary`, `.btn-secondary`, `.btn-ghost`)
- Built card components (`.card`, `.card-feature`) with hover effects
- Created layout utilities (`.section-padding`, `.container-padding`, `.max-width`)
- Added grid systems for different content layouts
- Implemented special effects like gradient text and accent borders

## ✅ **Homepage Content & Structure**
1. **Hero Section** - Eye-catching headline with gradient "Cospace" text, compelling description, and clear CTAs
2. **Social Proof** - Trust indicators with key metrics (10,000+ workspaces, 99.95% uptime, EU & US hosting)
3. **Value Pillars** - 4 feature cards highlighting core benefits with icons and descriptions
4. **Featured Capabilities** - Detailed breakdown of key features (Chat, Files, AppBuilder, Data)
5. **Use Cases** - Industry-specific tiles for Marketing, Design, Software, and Government
6. **Privacy Callout** - Prominent banner highlighting data residency options
7. **Final CTA** - Clear call-to-action with primary and secondary buttons

## ✅ **Design Principles Followed**
- **Typography**: Uses Inter font with proper hierarchy (foreground for headers, muted for body text)
- **Color System**: Follows established CSS variables (background, foreground, accent, muted)
- **Mobile-First**: Responsive design with proper breakpoints
- **Consistent Spacing**: Universal padding and margins across sections
- **Accessibility**: Proper contrast, touch targets, and semantic HTML
- **Performance**: Clean, efficient CSS with reusable classes
- **No Dark Theme**: Light theme only as requested

The homepage is now ready and provides a professional, modern experience that effectively communicates Cospace's value proposition while maintaining the established design system and following all the specified rules.

Perfect! I've added `text-transform: capitalize` to all the heading classes (`.heading-1`, `.heading-2`, `.heading-3`, and `.heading-4`) in the globals.css file. 

This CSS property will automatically capitalize the first letter of each word in all headers, making them appear in PascalCase/Capitalized format. For example:
- "meet cospace by neo14" becomes "Meet Cospace By Neo14"
- "built for modern teams" becomes "Built For Modern Teams"
- "one workspace, zero chaos" becomes "One Workspace, Zero Chaos"

The `text-transform: capitalize` property is applied globally to all heading classes, so any text using these classes will automatically be capitalized without needing to manually change the text content.

---

Perfect! I've fixed the build error by replacing all the `@apply` directives with native CSS. The issue was that Tailwind CSS v4 handles the `@apply` directive differently, and the custom classes I created weren't being recognized properly.

Here's what I changed:

## ✅ **Fixed CSS Issues**
1. **Replaced `@apply` with native CSS** - All custom classes now use standard CSS properties instead of Tailwind's `@apply` directive
2. **Used `color-mix()` for opacity** - Replaced Tailwind's opacity syntax (like `foreground/10`) with the modern `color-mix()` function
3. **Converted responsive utilities** - Replaced Tailwind's responsive prefixes with proper `@media` queries
4. **Maintained all functionality** - All the visual styling and behavior remains exactly the same

## ✅ **Key Changes Made**
- **Button components**: Converted to native CSS with proper hover states
- **Card components**: Used `color-mix()` for border opacity and shadow effects
- **Layout utilities**: Converted responsive padding and grid systems to media queries
- **Grid systems**: Proper CSS Grid with responsive breakpoints
- **Special effects**: Maintained gradient text and accent border functionality

The build should now work correctly with Tailwind CSS v4, and all the custom classes (`.card`, `.card-feature`, `.btn-primary`, etc.) will function as expected without any build errors.

---
